BakingRecipes.RecipeDescription:
These vanilla cupcakes are, by far, one of the most-loved recipes on this website. Using creamed butter, plus cake flour, sour cream, and egg whites (no yolks!), guarantees a soft, fluffy, and cake-like crumb. Pure vanilla extract plus the optional addition of vanilla beans seals in a classic vanilla flavor. Use a piping tip or knife to garnish each with vanilla buttercream.
 
Photo by Sally McKenney, visit Sally's Baking Addiction using the Recipe button for access to the full photo and recipe.
BakingRecipes.RecipeIngredients:
1 and 3/4 cups cake flour
3/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon baking sode
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 unsalted butter
1 cup granulated sugar
3 large egg whites
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1/2 cup sour cream
1/2 cup whole milk
vanilla buttercream

BakingRecipes.RecipeDescription:
With 11 million page views and counting since 2013, these super soft and chewy chocolate chip cookies are the most popular cookie recipe on my website. Melted butter, more brown sugar than white sugar, cornstarch, and an extra egg yolk guarantee the absolute chewiest chocolate chip cookie texture. And you don’t even need a mixer!
 
Photo by Sally McKenney, visit Sally's Baking Addiction using the Recipe button for access to the full photo and recipe.
BakingRecipes.RecipeIngredients:
2 and 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 and 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch
1/2 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup unsalted butter
3/4 cup brown sugar
1/2 granulated sugar
1 large egg + 1 egg yolk
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 and 1/4 cups chocolate chips

BakingRecipes.RecipeDescription:
These better-than-the-bakery blueberry scones are bursting with juicy blueberries. They’re buttery and moist with crisp, crumbly edges and soft, flaky centers. Crunchy coarse sugar and creamy vanilla icing are the perfect finishing touches!
 
Photo by Sally McKenney, visit Sally's Baking Addiction using the Recipe button for access to the full photo and recipe.
BakingRecipes.RecipeIngredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 cup granulated sugar
2 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter
1/2 cup heavy cream
1 large egg
1 and 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 heaping cup of blueberries
vanilla icing

BakingRecipes.RecipeDescription:
These banana muffins are soft, buttery, and spiced with cinnamon. They’re wonderful plain, with chopped walnuts, or even chocolate chips. You need 3 large ripe bananas and a few basic kitchen ingredients to get started.
 
Photo by Sally McKenney, visit Sally's Baking Addiction using the Recipe button for access to the full photo and recipe.
BakingRecipes.RecipeIngredients:
1 and 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1 and 1/2 cups mashed bananas
6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2/3 cup brown sugar
1 large egg
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 tablespoons milk
optional: chopped walnuts, pecans, or chocolate chips

BakingRecipes.RecipeDescription:
The one thing that sets this strawberry cake apart from others? Reduce fresh strawberry puree down and add to the best white cake batter. This strawberry cake completely blew me away. After years of mediocre from-scratch strawberry cakes, my expectations were pretty low. It was time to taste test my efforts. Biting into the first pastel-pink forkful was the moment of truth… I cried tears of joy. Or were those actual tears because I just dirtied every dish with all this strawberry cake recipe testing?
 
Photo by Sally McKenney, visit Sally's Baking Addiction using the Recipe button for access to the full photo and recipe.
BakingRecipes.RecipeIngredients:
Strawberry Puree
1 pound fresh strawberries
 
Cake
2 and 1/2 cups cake flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup unsalted butter
1 and 3/4 cups granulated sugar
5 large egg whites
1/3 cup sour cream
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1/2 cup whole milj
1/2 cup reduced strawberry puree
 
Strawberry Cream Cheese Frosting
1 cup freeze-dried strawberries
8 ounces full-fat cream cheese
1/2 cup unsalted butter
3 cups confectioners sugar
1-2 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
salt to taste
